intro: Hieracium lackschewitzii, commonly known as the Lackshewitz's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium lackschewitzii is often found in open habitats and is relatively resilient to environmental changes.
